Name: PROMETRYNE
Description: Prometryn is a diamino-1,3,5-triazine that is N,N'-di(propan-2-yl)-1,3,5-triazine-2,4-diamine substituted by a methylsulfanediyl group at position 6. It has a role as a herbicide, a xenobiotic and an environmental contaminant. It is a diamino-1,3,5-triazine and a methylthio-1,3,5-triazine.

fish_seafood_concentrations.References: (1) Hendriks AJ et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 17: 1885-98 (1998)
fish_seafood_concentrations.Value: Prometryne was reported at <5.0 ug/kg wet weight in zebra mussels (Dreissena polymorpha) and eels (Anguilla anguilla) from the Rhine-Meuse river delta in The Netherlands(1).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Muszkat L et al; Arch Insect Biochem Physiol 22: 487-99 (1993) (2) Bester K, Huhnerfuss H; Chemosphere 32: 1919-28 (1996) (3) Miles CJ, Pfeuffer RJ; Arch Environ Contam Toxicol 32: 337-45 (1997)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: Soil samples collected from a site which had been contaminated by a nearby pesticide manufacturing plant contained prometryne at 176 and 32 ppb at a sample depth of 6 and 300 cm, respectively(1). Concns of prometryne in German Wadden Sea sediments ranged from not detected to 3300 ng/kg wet weight(2). Prometryne was detected in 1 of 744 samples collected during a study of South Florida canal water and sediment at a concn of 12 ug/kg(3).

plant_translocations.content: The absorption of 14C-dipropetryn (2-ethylthio-4,6-bis-isopropylamine-s-triazine) and 14C-prometryn [2,4-bis(isopropylamino)-6-(methylthio)-s-triazine] by roots of intact seedlings of corn (Zea mays L. ‘Iowa Chief) and oats (Avena sativa L. ‘Cimarron’) was very extensive and occurred to about the same degree in both species after application to the root medium. The translocation of 14C-label of dipropetryn to the shoots was low in corn as compared to oats. Prometryn 14C-label was more readily translocated to the tops of corn than dipropetryn and was more readily translocated in oats than corn. Dipropetryn 14C-label entered excised leaves through the transpiration stream during a short exposure period and translocated to a greater extent in oats than in corn. The 14C-label of dipropetryn became immobilized in excised leaves after about 4 h. The 14C-label of prometryn was initially more mobile in excised leaves of oats than corn. However, translocation of the 14C-label of prometryn continued in both species during 10 h of treatment and there was very little difference in the final distribution pattern. DNP (2,4-dinitrophenol) did not affect the distribution pattern of the 14C-label of dipropetryn or prometryn in corn after 10 h treatments.
plant_translocations.reference: Basler, E., Murray, D. S., & Santelmann, P. W. (1978). Translocation of Dipropetryn and Prometryn in Seedlings and Excised Leaves of Oats (Avena sativa) and Corn (Zea mays). Weed Science, 26(4), 358-361.

method.Test Plant: Corn and oats were used as the test plants.
method.Apply Location: The 14C-labeled herbicides were applied to the soil around pre-germinated seedlings. Excised leaf uptake experiments involved applying 14C-herbicide solution to the cut leaf bases.
method.Plant Grown Condition: Pre-germinated seeds grown in plastic cartons with quartz sand at 30°C under 10 klux light.
method.Chemical Preparation: 14C-dipropetryn (8.6 μCi/mg) applied at 2 ppm in soil.10 ppm 14C-labeled herbicide solutions for excised leaf study.

plant_translocations.result: [{"Plant": "Corn", "Hours after application": 1, "5cm from base (% of absorbed)": 12.7, "10cm from base (%)": 1.6, "15cm from base (%)": 0.1}, {"Plant": "Corn", "Hours after application": 4, "5cm from base (% of absorbed)": 8.92, "10cm from base (%)": 7.26, "15cm from base (%)": 0.47}, {"Plant": "Corn", "Hours after application": 10, "5cm from base (% of absorbed)": 5.84, "10cm from base (%)": 10.05, "15cm from base (%)": 3.03}, {"Plant": "Oats", "Hours after application": 1, "5cm from base (% of absorbed)": 9.16, "10cm from base (%)": 5.3, "15cm from base (%)": 0.48}, {"Plant": "Oats", "Hours after application": 4, "5cm from base (% of absorbed)": 8.13, "10cm from base (%)": 8.36, "15cm from base (%)": 1.1}, {"Plant": "Oats", "Hours after application": 10, "5cm from base (% of absorbed)": 5.37, "10cm from base (%)": 8.57, "15cm from base (%)": 4.28}]

plant_translocations.content: Prometryn, a soil-applied herbicide used in cotton production, can cause cotton injury, and the mechanism of differential tolerance among cultivars was investigated. Prometryn-tolerant cultivars, Pima S-7 (Gossypium barbadense L.) and Acala 1517-75 (G. hirsutum L.), were compared to prometryn-sensitive Upland-type cultivars, Delta Pine 5415 (G. hirsutum) and Acala 2711 glandless (G. hirsutum). Studies on prometryn absorption, translocation to photosynthetic tissue or lysigenous glands, and metabolism showed that the tolerance differences could not be explained by differences in these factors. Despite greater uptake and translocation in root-treated seedlings compared to hypocotyl-treated ones, tolerance was not associated with prometryn concentration in lysigenous glands. Thus, the mechanism of differential prometryn tolerance in these cotton cultivars remains unclear.
plant_translocations.reference: Waldrop, M. P., Sterling, T. M., Khan, R. A., & Molin, W. T. (1996). Fate of prometryn in prometryn-tolerant and-susceptible cotton cultivars. Pesticide Biochemistry and Physiology, 56(2), 111-122.

method.Test Plant: Cotton (Gossypium hirsutum) cultivars - Pima S-7, Acala 1517-75, and Delta Pine 5415
method.Apply Location: Root and hypocotyl segments used for uptake and metabolism studies (no foliar application)
method.Plant Grown Condition: Cotton seeds were surface sterilized, germinated and grown in dark at 25°C for 4-6 days. Seedlings were used for excising root and hypocotyl segments.
method.Chemical Preparation: Radiolabeled [14C]prometryn (97.3% radiochemical purity, 7.41 Ci/mol) was dissolved in ethanol and diluted with pH 6 buffer to 7.41 μCi/L solution containing 0.07% ethanol.
method.Pesticide Application Details for the Pl: 4-day-old root and hypocotyl segments (1 cm) were incubated in the 14C-prometryn solution (1 mM) for 120 min to study uptake. Tissues were rinsed after incubation to remove external radiolabel.
method.Other Information: Metabolite analysis was done by extracting tissues with methanol/water (80/20) followed by HPLC separation and radiodetection.
